title.raw: 《衛康叔世家》 House of Wei Kang Shu

sentences.zh: 衛康叔名封，周武王同母少弟也。

translations.literal: Wei Kang Shu named Feng, Zhou Wu Wang same mother younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Kang Shu, named Feng, was King Wu of Zhou's younger brother from the same mother.

sentences.zh: 其次尚有冉季，冉季最少。

translations.literal: Next still had Ran Ji, Ran Ji youngest.
translations.idiomatic: Next there was still Ran Ji, who was the youngest.

sentences.zh: 武王已克殷紂，復以殷餘民封紂子武庚祿父，比諸侯，以奉其先祀勿絕。

translations.literal: Wu Wang already conquered Yin Zhou, again with Yin remnant people enfeoffed Zhou son Wu Geng Lu Fu, equal to feudal lords, to continue their ancestor sacrifices not end.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already conquered Yin Zhou, and again enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu with Yin's remnant people, making him equal to the feudal lords, to continue their ancestor sacrifices without ending them.

sentences.zh: 為武庚未集，恐其有賊心，武王乃令其弟管叔、蔡叔傅相武庚祿父，以和其民。

translations.literal: Because Wu Geng not gathered, feared he had traitor heart, Wu Wang then commanded his younger brothers Guan Shu, Cai Shu to tutor assist Wu Geng Lu Fu, to harmonize their people.
translations.idiomatic: Because Wu Geng had not yet gathered support, fearing he had treacherous intentions, King Wu then commanded his younger brothers Guan Shu and Cai Shu to tutor and assist Wu Geng Lu Fu, to harmonize their people.

sentences.zh: 武王既崩，成王少。

translations.literal: Wu Wang already passed, Cheng Wang young.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already passed away. King Cheng was young.

sentences.zh: 周公旦代成王治，當國。

translations.literal: Zhou Gong Dan substituted Cheng Wang govern, held state.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan substituted for King Cheng in governing and held the state.

sentences.zh: 管叔、蔡叔疑周公，乃與武庚祿父作亂，欲攻成周。

translations.literal: Guan Shu, Cai Shu doubted Zhou Gong, then with Wu Geng Lu Fu made rebellion, desired attack Cheng Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and Cai Shu doubted the Duke of Zhou, so they made rebellion with Wu Geng Lu Fu, desiring to attack Cheng Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公旦以成王命興師伐殷，殺武庚祿父、管叔，放蔡叔，以武庚殷餘民封康叔為衛君，居河、淇閒故商墟。

translations.literal: Zhou Gong Dan with Cheng Wang command raised troops attacked Yin, killed Wu Geng Lu Fu, Guan Shu, banished Cai Shu, with Wu Geng Yin remnant people enfeoffed Kang Shu as Wei lord, resided between He, Qi former Shang ruins.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan, with King Cheng's command, raised troops to attack Yin, killed Wu Geng Lu Fu and Guan Shu, banished Cai Shu, and with Wu Geng's Yin remnant people enfeoffed Kang Shu as lord of Wei, residing between the He and Qi rivers in the former Shang ruins.

sentences.zh: 周公旦懼康叔齒少，乃申告康叔曰：「必求殷之賢人君子長者，問其先殷所以興，所以亡，而務愛民。」

translations.literal: Zhou Gong Dan feared Kang Shu teeth young, then repeatedly admonished Kang Shu said: 'Must seek Yin worthy people gentlemen elders, ask their former Yin why rose, why perished, and diligently love people.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan feared Kang Shu was young, so he repeatedly admonished Kang Shu, saying: 'You must seek Yin's worthy people, gentlemen, and elders, ask them why their former Yin rose and why it perished, and diligently love the people.'

sentences.zh: 告以紂所以亡者以淫於酒，酒之失，婦人是用，故紂之亂自此始。

translations.literal: Admonished with Zhou why perished because licentious in wine, wine harm, women used, therefore Zhou chaos from this began.
translations.idiomatic: He admonished that Zhou perished because he was licentious with wine. Wine's harm was that women were employed, so Zhou's chaos began from this.

sentences.zh: 為梓材，示君子可法則。

translations.literal: Made Zi Cai, showed gentlemen can model rules.
translations.idiomatic: He made the 'Zi Cai' to show gentlemen the rules they could model themselves after.

sentences.zh: 故謂之《康誥》、《酒誥》、《梓材》以命之。

translations.literal: Therefore called 'Kang Gao', 'Jiu Gao', 'Zi Cai' to command him.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they are called the 'Kang Gao', 'Jiu Gao', and 'Zi Cai' to command him.

sentences.zh: 康叔之國，既以此命，能和集其民，民大說。

translations.literal: Kang Shu went to state, already with this command, could harmonize gather his people, people greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu went to his state. Already with this command, he could harmonize and gather his people, and the people were greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 成王長，用事，舉康叔為周司寇，賜衛寶祭器，以章有德。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang grew up, handled affairs, raised Kang Shu to be Zhou Si Kou, granted Wei precious sacrificial vessels, to display having virtue.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng grew up and handled affairs. He raised Kang Shu to be Zhou's Minister of Crime, granted Wei precious sacrificial vessels, to display his virtue.

sentences.zh: 康叔卒，子康伯代立。

translations.literal: Kang Shu died, son Kang Bo replaced him.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu died, and his son Kang Bo replaced him.

sentences.zh: 康伯卒，子考伯立。

translations.literal: Kang Bo died, son Kao Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Bo died, and his son Kao Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 考伯卒，子嗣伯立。

translations.literal: Kao Bo died, son Si Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kao Bo died, and his son Si Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 嗣伯卒，子偼伯立。

translations.literal: Si Bo died, son You Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Si Bo died, and his son You Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 偼伯卒，子靖伯立。

translations.literal: You Bo died, son Jing Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: You Bo died, and his son Jing Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 靖伯卒，子貞伯立。

translations.literal: Jing Bo died, son Zhen Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Bo died, and his son Zhen Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 貞伯卒，子頃侯立。

translations.literal: Zhen Bo died, son Qing Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Zhen Bo died, and his son Duke Qing ascended.

sentences.zh: 頃侯厚賂周夷王，夷王命衛為侯。

translations.literal: Qing Hou thickly bribed Zhou Yi Wang, Yi Wang commanded Wei to be hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing thickly bribed King Yi of Zhou. King Yi commanded Wei to be a hou.

sentences.zh: 頃侯立十二年卒，子釐侯立。

translations.literal: Qing Hou ascended twelve years died, son Xi Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing ascended for twelve years and died. His son Duke Xi ascended.

sentences.zh: 釐侯十三年，周厲王出奔于彘，共和行政焉。

translations.literal: Xi Hou thirteenth year, Zhou Li Wang fled to Zhi, Gong He administered government there.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's thirteenth year, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, and the Gong He administered government there.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，周宣王立。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Zhou Xuan Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，釐侯卒，太子共伯餘立為君。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, Xi Hou died, crown prince Gong Bo Yu ascended as lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Duke Xi died, and Crown Prince Gong Bo Yu ascended as lord.

sentences.zh: 共伯弟和有寵於釐侯，多予之賂；

translations.literal: Gong Bo younger brother He had favor with Xi Hou, much gave him bribes;
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo's younger brother He had favor with Duke Xi, who gave him many bribes;

sentences.zh: 和以其賂賂士，以襲攻共伯於墓上，共伯入釐侯羨自殺。

translations.literal: He with his bribes bribed warriors, to suddenly attack Gong Bo at tomb above, Gong Bo entered Xi Hou pavilion committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He used his bribes to bribe warriors, to suddenly attack Gong Bo at the tomb above. Gong Bo entered Duke Xi's pavilion and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 衛人因葬之釐侯旁，謚曰共伯，而立和為衛侯，是為武公。

translations.literal: Wei people therefore buried him beside Xi Hou, posthumous name Gong Bo, and established He as Wei Hou, this was Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei people therefore buried him beside Duke Xi, gave him the posthumous name Gong Bo, and established He as Wei's hou, who became Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公即位，修康叔之政，百姓和集。

translations.literal: Wu Gong ascended throne, repaired Kang Shu politics, hundred surnames harmonious gathered.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu ascended the throne and repaired Kang Shu's policies. The people were harmonious and gathered together.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，犬戎殺周幽王，武公將兵往佐周平戎，甚有功，周平王命武公為公。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, Quan Rong killed Zhou You Wang, Wu Gong led troops went assist Zhou pacify Rong, very had merit, Zhou Ping Wang commanded Wu Gong to be gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, the Quan Rong killed King You of Zhou. Duke Wu led troops to assist Zhou in pacifying the Rong, and had great merit. King Ping of Zhou commanded Duke Wu to be a gong.

sentences.zh: 五十五年，卒，子莊公揚立。

translations.literal: Fifty-fifth year, died, son Zhuang Gong Yang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fifth year, he died, and his son Duke Zhuang Yang ascended.

sentences.zh: 莊公五年，取齊女為夫人，好而無子。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong fifth year, took Qi woman as wife, loved but no son.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, he took a Qi woman as his wife. He loved her but she had no son.

sentences.zh: 又取陳女為夫人，生子，蚤死。

translations.literal: Again took Chen woman as wife, gave birth son, early died.
translations.idiomatic: He again took a Chen woman as his wife. She gave birth to a son, but he died early.

sentences.zh: 陳女女弟亦幸於莊公，而生子完。

translations.literal: Chen woman younger sister also favored by Zhuang Gong, and gave birth son Wan.
translations.idiomatic: The Chen woman's younger sister was also favored by Duke Zhuang, and gave birth to a son named Wan.

sentences.zh: 完母死，莊公令夫人齊女子之，立為太子。

translations.literal: Wan mother died, Zhuang Gong commanded wife Qi woman raise him, established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Wan's mother died. Duke Zhuang commanded his wife, the Qi woman, to raise him and established him as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 莊公有寵妾，生子州吁。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong had favored concubine, gave birth son Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had a favored concubine who gave birth to a son named Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 十八年，州吁長，好兵，莊公使將。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Zhou Xu grown, liked war, Zhuang Gong made him general.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Zhou Xu had grown up. He liked war, and Duke Zhuang made him a general.

sentences.zh: 石碏諫莊公曰：「庶子好兵，使將，亂自此起。」

translations.literal: Shi Que admonished Zhuang Gong said: 'Concubine's son likes war, makes him general, chaos from this arises.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Que admonished Duke Zhuang, saying: 'The concubine's son likes war. Making him a general—chaos will arise from this.'

sentences.zh: 不聽。

translations.literal: Not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊公卒，太子完立，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Zhuang Gong died, crown prince Wan ascended, this was Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang died, and Crown Prince Wan ascended, who became Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公二年，弟州吁驕奢，桓公絀之，州吁出奔。

translations.literal: Huan Gong second year, younger brother Zhou Xu arrogant extravagant, Huan Gong demoted him, Zhou Xu fled.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan's second year, his younger brother Zhou Xu was arrogant and extravagant. Duke Huan demoted him, and Zhou Xu fled.

sentences.zh: 十三年，鄭伯弟段攻其兄，不勝，亡，而州吁求與之友。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Zheng Bo younger brother Duan attacked his elder brother, not victorious, fled, and Zhou Xu sought to befriend him.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Zheng Bo's younger brother Duan attacked his elder brother, was not victorious, fled, and Zhou Xu sought to befriend him.

sentences.zh: 十六年，州吁收聚衛亡人以襲殺桓公，州吁自立為衛君。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Zhou Xu gathered Wei fugitives to suddenly kill Huan Gong, Zhou Xu self established as Wei lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Zhou Xu gathered Wei fugitives to suddenly kill Duke Huan, and Zhou Xu self-established as Wei's lord.

sentences.zh: 為鄭伯弟段欲伐鄭，請宋、陳、蔡與俱，三國皆許州吁。

translations.literal: For Zheng Bo younger brother Duan desired attack Zheng, requested Song, Chen, Cai go with him, three states all promised Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: For Zheng Bo's younger brother Duan who desired to attack Zheng, he requested Song, Chen, and Cai to go with him. The three states all promised Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 州吁新立，好兵，弒桓公，衛人皆不愛。

translations.literal: Zhou Xu newly established, liked war, assassinated Huan Gong, Wei people all not love.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Xu was newly established, liked war, assassinated Duke Huan—the Wei people all did not love him.

sentences.zh: 石碏乃因桓公母家於陳，詳為善州吁。

translations.literal: Shi Que then used Huan Gong mother family at Chen, pretended to be good to Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Que then used Duke Huan's mother's family in Chen and pretended to be good to Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 至鄭郊，石碏與陳侯共謀，使右宰丑進食，因殺州吁于濮，而迎桓公弟晉於邢而立之，是為宣公。

translations.literal: Arrived Zheng outskirts, Shi Que with Chen Hou together plotted, made right prime minister Chou advance food, took advantage killed Zhou Xu at Pu, and welcomed Huan Gong younger brother Jin from Xing and established him, this was Xuan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: They arrived at Zheng's outskirts. Shi Que plotted together with the Chen hou, had the right prime minister Chou advance food, and took advantage to kill Zhou Xu at Pu. They welcomed Duke Huan's younger brother Jin from Xing and established him, who became Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公七年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong seventh year, Lu assassinated their lord Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's seventh year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 九年，宋督弒其君殤公，及孔父。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Song Du assassinated their lord Shang Gong, and Kong Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Song's Du assassinated their lord Duke Shang, and Kong Fu.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉曲沃莊伯弒其君哀侯。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Jin Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated their lord Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Jin's Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated their lord Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 十八年，初，宣公愛夫人夷姜，夷姜生子伋，以為太子，而令右公子傅之。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, beginning, Xuan Gong loved wife Yi Jiang, Yi Jiang gave birth son Ji, made him crown prince, and commanded right prince tutor him.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, initially Duke Xuan loved his wife Yi Jiang. Yi Jiang gave birth to a son named Ji, made him crown prince, and commanded the right prince to tutor him.

sentences.zh: 右公子為太子取齊女，未入室，而宣公見所欲為太子婦者好，說而自取之，更為太子取他女。

translations.literal: Right prince for crown prince took Qi woman, not yet entered chamber, and Xuan Gong saw desired to be crown prince wife good, pleased and self took her, changed for crown prince took other woman.
translations.idiomatic: The right prince took a Qi woman for the crown prince. She had not yet entered the chamber, but Duke Xuan saw that the one desired to be the crown prince's wife was good, was pleased and took her himself, and changed to take another woman for the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 宣公得齊女，生子壽、子朔，令左公子傅之。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong got Qi woman, gave birth son Shou, son Shuo, commanded left prince tutor them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan got the Qi woman and she gave birth to sons Shou and Shuo. He commanded the left prince to tutor them.

sentences.zh: 太子伋母死，宣公正夫人與朔共讒惡太子伋。

translations.literal: Crown prince Ji mother died, Xuan Gong proper wife with Shuo together slandered hated crown prince Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Ji's mother died. Duke Xuan's proper wife together with Shuo slandered and hated Crown Prince Ji.

sentences.zh: 宣公自以其奪太子妻也，心惡太子，欲廢之。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong self because he seized crown prince wife, heart hated crown prince, desired depose him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan himself, because he had seized the crown prince's wife, hated the crown prince in his heart and desired to depose him.

sentences.zh: 及聞其惡，大怒，乃使太子伋於齊而令盜遮界上殺之，與太子白旄，而告界盜見持白旄者殺之。

translations.literal: And heard their slander, greatly angered, then sent crown prince Ji to Qi and commanded robbers block border kill him, gave crown prince white banner, and told border robbers see holder of white banner kill him.
translations.idiomatic: And when he heard their slander, he was greatly angered. He then sent Crown Prince Ji to Qi and commanded robbers to block him at the border and kill him. He gave the crown prince a white banner, and told the border robbers to kill whoever held the white banner.

sentences.zh: 且行，子朔之兄壽，太子異母弟也，知朔之惡太子而君欲殺之，乃謂太子曰：「界盜見太子白旄，即殺太子，太子可毋行。」

translations.literal: About to go, Zi Shuo's elder brother Shou, crown prince different mother younger brother, knew Shuo hated crown prince and lord desired kill him, then told crown prince said: 'Border robbers see crown prince white banner, immediately kill crown prince, crown prince can not go.'
translations.idiomatic: About to go, Zi Shuo's elder brother Shou— the crown prince's half-brother from a different mother—knew that Shuo hated the crown prince and the lord desired to kill him. He then told the crown prince, saying: 'The border robbers will see the crown prince's white banner and immediately kill the crown prince. The crown prince can choose not to go.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「逆父命求生，不可。」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Go against father command seek life, not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'To go against my father's command and seek life is not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 遂行。

translations.literal: Then went.
translations.idiomatic: He then went.

sentences.zh: 壽見太子不止，乃盜其白旄而先馳至界。

translations.literal: Shou saw crown prince not stop, then stole his white banner and first galloped to border.
translations.idiomatic: Shou saw that the crown prince would not stop, so he stole his white banner and galloped first to the border.

sentences.zh: 界盜見其驗，即殺之。

translations.literal: Border robbers saw the token, immediately killed him.
translations.idiomatic: The border robbers saw the token and immediately killed him.

sentences.zh: 壽已死，而太子伋又至，謂盜曰：「所當殺乃我也。」

translations.literal: Shou already dead, and crown prince Ji again arrived, told robbers said: 'What should be killed is me.'
translations.idiomatic: Shou was already dead, and Crown Prince Ji arrived again. He told the robbers, saying: 'The one who should be killed is me.'

sentences.zh: 盜并殺太子伋，以報宣公。

translations.literal: Robbers together killed crown prince Ji, to report to Xuan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The robbers together killed Crown Prince Ji, to report to Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公乃以子朔為太子。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong then made Zi Shuo crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan then made Zi Shuo the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十九年，宣公卒，太子朔立，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Xuan Gong died, crown prince Shuo ascended, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Xuan died, and Crown Prince Shuo ascended, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 左右公子不平朔之立也，惠公四年，左右公子怨惠公之讒殺前太子伋而代立，乃作亂，攻惠公，立太子伋之弟黔牟為君，惠公奔齊。

translations.literal: Left right princes not content Shuo establishment, Hui Gong fourth year, left right princes resented Hui Gong slandered killed previous crown prince Ji and replaced him, then made rebellion, attacked Hui Gong, established crown prince Ji younger brother Qian Mou as lord, Hui Gong fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The left and right princes were not content with Shuo's establishment. In Duke Hui's fourth year, the left and right princes resented Duke Hui for slandering and killing the previous Crown Prince Ji to replace him. They then made rebellion, attacked Duke Hui, established Crown Prince Ji's younger brother Qian Mou as lord, and Duke Hui fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 衛君黔牟立八年，齊襄公率諸侯奉王命共伐衛，納衛惠公，誅左右公子。

translations.literal: Wei lord Qian Mou ascended eight years, Qi Xiang Gong led feudal lords received wang command together attacked Wei, received Wei Hui Gong, executed left right princes.
translations.idiomatic: Wei lord Qian Mou ascended for eight years. Duke Xiang of Qi led the feudal lords who received the wang's command to together attack Wei, received Duke Hui of Wei, and executed the left and right princes.

sentences.zh: 衛君黔牟奔于周，惠公復立。

translations.literal: Wei lord Qian Mou fled to Zhou, Hui Gong again ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Wei lord Qian Mou fled to Zhou, and Duke Hui ascended again.

sentences.zh: 惠公立三年出亡，亡八年復入，與前通年凡十三年矣。

translations.literal: Hui Gong ascended three years went into exile, exiled eight years again entered, with previous continuous years altogether thirteen years.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui ascended for three years and went into exile. He was exiled for eight years and entered again. With the previous continuous years, altogether thirteen years.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，惠公怨周之容舍黔牟，與燕伐周。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Hui Gong resented Zhou harbored Qian Mou, with Yan attacked Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Hui resented Zhou for harboring Qian Mou, and with Yan attacked Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周惠王奔溫，衛、燕立惠王弟穨為王。

translations.literal: Zhou Hui Wang fled Wen, Wei, Yan established Hui Wang younger brother Kui as wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Zhou fled to Wen. Wei and Yan established King Hui's younger brother Kui as wang.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，鄭復納惠王。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Zheng again received Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Zheng again received King Hui.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，惠公卒，子懿公赤立。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Hui Gong died, son Yi Gong Chi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Yi Chi ascended.

sentences.zh: 懿公即位，好鶴，淫樂奢侈。

translations.literal: Yi Gong ascended throne, liked cranes, licentious pleasure extravagant.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yi ascended the throne. He liked cranes and was licentious, pleasure-loving, and extravagant.

sentences.zh: 九年，翟伐衛，衛懿公欲發兵，兵或畔。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Di attacked Wei, Wei Yi Gong desired raise troops, troops some rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, the Di attacked Wei. Duke Yi of Wei desired to raise troops, but some of the troops rebelled.

sentences.zh: 大臣言曰：「君好鶴，鶴可令擊翟。」

translations.literal: Grand ministers said: 'Lord likes cranes, cranes can be commanded to strike Di.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand ministers said: 'The lord likes cranes. The cranes can be commanded to strike the Di.'

sentences.zh: 翟於是遂入，殺懿公。

translations.literal: Di therefore then entered, killed Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Di therefore then entered and killed Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 懿公之立也，百姓大臣皆不服。

translations.literal: Yi Gong when established, hundred surnames grand ministers all not submit.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Yi was established, the common people and grand ministers all did not submit.

sentences.zh: 自懿公父惠公朔之讒殺太子伋代立至於懿公，常欲敗之，卒滅惠公之後而更立黔牟之弟昭伯頑之子申為君，是為戴公。

translations.literal: From Yi Gong father Hui Gong Shuo slandered killed crown prince Ji replaced him until Yi Gong, often desired overthrow them, finally extinguished Hui Gong descendants and changed established Qian Mou younger brother Zhao Bo Wan son Shen as lord, this was Dai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: From Duke Yi's father Duke Hui Shuo who slandered and killed Crown Prince Ji to replace him, until Duke Yi, they often desired to overthrow them. They finally extinguished Duke Hui's descendants and changed to establish Qian Mou's younger brother Zhao Bo Wan's son Shen as lord, who became Duke Dai.

sentences.zh: 戴公申元年卒。

translations.literal: Dai Gong Shen first year died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dai Shen died in his first year.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公以衛數亂，乃率諸侯伐翟，為衛筑楚丘，立戴公弟燬為衛君，是為文公。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong because Wei frequently in chaos, then led feudal lords attacked Di, for Wei built Chu Qiu, established Dai Gong younger brother Hui as Wei lord, this was Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi, because Wei was frequently in chaos, then led the feudal lords to attack the Di. For Wei he built Chu Qiu and established Duke Dai's younger brother Hui as Wei's lord, who became Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公以亂故奔齊，齊人入之。

translations.literal: Wen Gong because chaos fled Qi, Qi people entered him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen, because of the chaos, fled to Qi, and the Qi people brought him in.

sentences.zh: 初，翟殺懿公也，衛人憐之，思復立宣公前死太子伋之後，伋子又死，而代伋死者子壽又無子。

translations.literal: Beginning, Di killed Yi Gong, Wei people pitied him, thought again establish Xuan Gong previously died crown prince Ji descendants, Ji son again died, and replaced Ji died son Shou again no son.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when the Di killed Duke Yi, the Wei people pitied him and thought to again establish Duke Xuan's previously deceased Crown Prince Ji's descendants. Ji's son had also died, and the one who died in Ji's place, Shou, also had no son.

sentences.zh: 太子伋同母弟二人：其一曰黔牟，黔牟嘗代惠公為君，八年復去；

translations.literal: Crown prince Ji same mother younger brothers two: one called Qian Mou, Qian Mou once replaced Hui Gong as lord, eight years again left;
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Ji had two same-mother younger brothers: one named Qian Mou. Qian Mou once replaced Duke Hui as lord for eight years, then left again;

sentences.zh: 其二曰昭伯。

translations.literal: The second called Zhao Bo.
translations.idiomatic: The second was called Zhao Bo.

sentences.zh: 昭伯、黔牟皆已前死，故立昭伯子申為戴公。

translations.literal: Zhao Bo, Qian Mou both already previously died, therefore established Zhao Bo son Shen as Dai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Bo and Qian Mou had both already died previously, so they established Zhao Bo's son Shen as Duke Dai.

sentences.zh: 戴公卒，復立其弟燬為文公。

translations.literal: Dai Gong died, again established his younger brother Hui as Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dai died, and they again established his younger brother Hui as Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公初立，輕賦平罪，身自勞，與百姓同苦，以收衛民。

translations.literal: Wen Gong first established, light taxes equal punishments, body self labored, with hundred surnames same bitter, to gather Wei people.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen was first established. He lightened taxes and equalized punishments, labored with his own body, shared the same bitterness with the common people, to gather the Wei people.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉公子重耳過，無禮。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Jin prince Chong Er passed, without ritual.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Jin's Prince Chong Er passed through, without proper ritual.

sentences.zh: 十七年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Qi Huan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，文公卒，子成公鄭立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Wen Gong died, son Cheng Gong Zheng ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and his son Duke Cheng Zheng ascended.

sentences.zh: 成公三年，晉欲假道於衛救宋，成公不許。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong third year, Jin desired borrow road at Wei save Song, Cheng Gong not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Cheng's third year, Jin desired to borrow a road through Wei to save Song, but Duke Cheng did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 晉更從南河度，救宋。

translations.literal: Jin changed from south river crossed, saved Song.
translations.idiomatic: Jin changed and crossed from the south river to save Song.

sentences.zh: 徵師於衛，衛大夫欲許，成公不肯。

translations.literal: Summoned troops from Wei, Wei grand officers desired permit, Cheng Gong not willing.
translations.idiomatic: They summoned troops from Wei. Wei's grand officers desired to permit it, but Duke Cheng was not willing.

sentences.zh: 大夫元咺攻成公，成公出奔。

translations.literal: Grand officer Yuan Tiao attacked Cheng Gong, Cheng Gong fled.
translations.idiomatic: Grand officer Yuan Tiao attacked Duke Cheng, and Duke Cheng fled.

sentences.zh: 晉文公重耳伐衛，分其地予宋，討前過無禮及不救宋患也。

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong Chong Er attacked Wei, divided its land gave to Song, punished previous passing without ritual and not saving Song calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen of Jin Chong Er attacked Wei, divided its land and gave it to Song, punishing the previous passing without ritual and not saving Song's calamity.

sentences.zh: 衛成公遂出奔陳。

translations.literal: Wei Cheng Gong then fled to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Cheng of Wei then fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 二歲，如周求入，與晉文公會。

translations.literal: Two years, went to Zhou sought entry, with Jin Wen Gong assembled.
translations.idiomatic: After two years, he went to Zhou to seek entry and assembled with Duke Wen of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉使人鴆衛成公，成公私於周主鴆，令薄，得不死。

translations.literal: Jin made people poison Wei Cheng Gong, Cheng Gong privately with Zhou lord poison, commanded thin, obtained not die.
translations.idiomatic: Jin had people poison Duke Cheng of Wei. Duke Cheng privately bribed Zhou's poison lord and commanded it to be thin, so he obtained not dying.

sentences.zh: 已而周為請晉文公，卒入之衛，而誅元咺，衛君瑕出奔。

translations.literal: Already then Zhou for requested Jin Wen Gong, finally entered him Wei, and executed Yuan Tiao, Wei lord Xia fled.
translations.idiomatic: Then Zhou requested on his behalf to Duke Wen of Jin. He finally entered Wei, and executed Yuan Tiao. Wei lord Xia fled.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉文公卒。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Jin Wen Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 十二年，成公朝晉襄公。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Cheng Gong paid court to Jin Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Duke Cheng paid court to Duke Xiang of Jin.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Qin Mu Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊邴歜弒其君懿公。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Qi Bing Chan assassinated their lord Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi's Bing Chan assassinated their lord Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，成公卒，子穆公遫立。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, Cheng Gong died, son Mu Gong Suo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Duke Cheng died, and his son Duke Mu Suo ascended.

sentences.zh: 穆公二年，楚莊王伐陳，殺夏徵舒。

translations.literal: Mu Gong second year, Chu Zhuang Wang attacked Chen, killed Xia Zheng Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Mu's second year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked Chen and killed Xia Zheng Shu.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王圍鄭，鄭降，復釋之。

translations.literal: Third year, Chu Zhuang Wang surrounded Zheng, Zheng surrendered, again freed them.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. Zheng surrendered, and he again freed them.

sentences.zh: 十一年，孫良夫救魯伐齊，復得侵地。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Sun Liang Fu saved Lu attacked Qi, again obtained invaded land.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Sun Liang Fu saved Lu and attacked Qi, again obtaining the invaded land.

sentences.zh: 穆公卒，子定公臧立。

translations.literal: Mu Gong died, son Ding Gong Zang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu died, and his son Duke Ding Zang ascended.

sentences.zh: 定公十二年卒，子獻公衎立。

translations.literal: Ding Gong twelfth year died, son Xian Gong Kan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding died in his twelfth year, and his son Duke Xian Kan ascended.

sentences.zh: 獻公十三年，公令師曹教宮妾鼓琴，妾不善，曹笞之。

translations.literal: Xian Gong thirteenth year, gong commanded teacher Cao teach palace concubine play zither, concubine not good, Cao whipped her.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's thirteenth year, the duke commanded Teacher Cao to teach the palace concubine to play the zither. The concubine was not good, and Cao whipped her.

sentences.zh: 妾以幸惡曹於公，公亦笞曹三百。

translations.literal: Concubine with favor hated Cao to gong, gong also whipped Cao three hundred.
translations.idiomatic: The concubine, with favor, hated Cao to the duke. The duke also whipped Cao three hundred times.

sentences.zh: 十八年，獻公戒孫文子、甯惠子食，皆往。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Xian Gong summoned Sun Wen Zi, Ning Hui Zi to eat, all went.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xian summoned Sun Wen Zi and Ning Hui Zi to eat, and they all went.

sentences.zh: 日旰不召，而去射鴻於囿。

translations.literal: Day late not summoned, and went shoot geese at park.
translations.idiomatic: The day grew late without summons, and they went to shoot geese in the park.

sentences.zh: 二子從之，公不釋射服與之言。

translations.literal: Two sons followed him, gong not removed hunting clothes spoke with them.
translations.idiomatic: The two sons followed him. The duke did not remove his hunting clothes and spoke with them.

sentences.zh: 二子怒，如宿。

translations.literal: Two sons angered, went to Su.
translations.idiomatic: The two sons were angered and went to Su.

sentences.zh: 孫文子子數侍公飲，使師曹歌巧言之卒章。

translations.literal: Sun Wen Zi son often served gong drink, made Shi Cao sing clever words final stanza.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Wen Zi's son often served the duke drinks and made Shi Cao sing the final stanza of clever words.

sentences.zh: 師曹又怒公之嘗笞三百，乃歌之，欲以怒孫文子，報衛獻公。

translations.literal: Shi Cao also angered gong once whipped three hundred, then sang it, desired to anger Sun Wen Zi, repay Wei Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Cao was also angered that the duke had once whipped him three hundred times. He then sang it, desiring to anger Sun Wen Zi and repay Duke Xian of Wei.

sentences.zh: 文子語蘧伯玉，伯玉曰：「臣不知也。」

translations.literal: Wen Zi told Qu Bo Yu, Bo Yu said: 'Minister not know.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zi told Qu Bo Yu. Bo Yu said: 'This minister does not know.'

sentences.zh: 遂攻出獻公。

translations.literal: Then attacked expelled Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: They then attacked and expelled Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公奔齊，齊置衛獻公於聚邑。

translations.literal: Xian Gong fled Qi, Qi placed Wei Xian Gong at Ju yi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian fled to Qi. Qi placed Duke Xian of Wei at Ju yi.

sentences.zh: 孫文子、甯惠子共立定公弟秋為衛君，是為殤公。

translations.literal: Sun Wen Zi, Ning Hui Zi together established Ding Gong younger brother Qiu as Wei lord, this was Shang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Wen Zi and Ning Hui Zi together established Duke Ding's younger brother Qiu as Wei's lord, who became Duke Shang.

sentences.zh: 殤公秋立，封孫文子林父於宿。

translations.literal: Shang Gong Qiu ascended, enfeoffed Sun Wen Zi Lin Fu at Su.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shang Qiu ascended and enfeoffed Sun Wen Zi Lin Fu at Su.

sentences.zh: 十二年，甯喜與孫林父爭寵相惡，殤公使甯喜攻孫林父。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Ning Xi with Sun Lin Fu contended favor mutually hated, Shang Gong made Ning Xi attack Sun Lin Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Ning Xi and Sun Lin Fu contended for favor and mutually hated each other. Duke Shang made Ning Xi attack Sun Lin Fu.

sentences.zh: 林父奔晉，復求入故衛獻公。

translations.literal: Lin Fu fled Jin, again sought enter former Wei Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Lin Fu fled to Jin and again sought to enter the former Duke Xian of Wei.

sentences.zh: 獻公在齊，齊景公聞之，與衛獻公如晉求入。

translations.literal: Xian Gong in Qi, Qi Jing Gong heard it, with Wei Xian Gong went to Jin sought entry.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian was in Qi. Duke Jing of Qi heard of it and with Duke Xian of Wei went to Jin to seek entry.

sentences.zh: 晉為伐衛，誘與盟。

translations.literal: Jin for attacked Wei, lured with alliance.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Wei on his behalf and lured them with an alliance.

sentences.zh: 衛殤公會晉平公，平公執殤公與甯喜而復入衛獻公。

translations.literal: Wei Shang Gong assembled Jin Ping Gong, Ping Gong seized Shang Gong and Ning Xi and again entered Wei Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shang of Wei assembled with Duke Ping of Jin. Duke Ping seized Duke Shang and Ning Xi and again entered Duke Xian of Wei.

sentences.zh: 獻公亡在外十二年而入。

translations.literal: Xian Gong fled outside twelve years then entered.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian, who had fled outside for twelve years, then entered.

sentences.zh: 獻公後元年，誅甯喜。

translations.literal: Xian Gong returned first year, executed Ning Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's first year after returning, he executed Ning Xi.

sentences.zh: 三年，吳延陵季子使過衛，見蘧伯玉、史，曰：「衛多君子，其國無故。」

translations.literal: Third year, Wu Yanling Ji Zi envoy passed Wei, saw Qu Bo Yu, Shi, said: 'Wei has many noblemen, their state without calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Wu's Yanling Ji Zi, on an envoy mission, passed through Wei. He saw Qu Bo Yu and Shi, and said: 'Wei has many noblemen. Their state will be without calamity.'

sentences.zh: 過宿，孫林父為擊磬，曰：「不樂，音大悲，使衛亂乃此矣。」

translations.literal: Passed Su, Sun Lin Fu for struck qing, said: 'Not happy, sound greatly sad, make Wei chaos this will be it.'
translations.idiomatic: He passed through Su. Sun Lin Fu struck the qing for him and said: 'Not happy. The sound is greatly sad. The cause of Wei's chaos will be this.'

sentences.zh: 是年，獻公卒，子襄公惡立。

translations.literal: This year, Xian Gong died, son Xiang Gong Wu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Duke Xian died, and his son Duke Xiang Wu ascended.

sentences.zh: 襄公六年，楚靈王會諸侯，襄公稱病不往。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong sixth year, Chu Ling Wang assembled feudal lords, Xiang Gong claimed illness not went.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's sixth year, King Ling of Chu assembled the feudal lords. Duke Xiang claimed illness and did not go.

sentences.zh: 九年，襄公卒。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Xiang Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Xiang died.

sentences.zh: 初，襄公有賤妾，幸之，有身，夢有人謂曰：「我康叔也，令若子必有衛，名而子曰『元』。」

translations.literal: Beginning, Xiang Gong had lowly concubine, favored her, had body, dreamed someone told said: 'I Kang Shu, make your son must have Wei, name your son 'Yuan'.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Xiang had a lowly concubine whom he favored. She became pregnant and dreamed that someone told her: 'I am Kang Shu. Make sure your son will have Wei. Name your son 'Yuan'.'

sentences.zh: 妾怪之，問孔成子。

translations.literal: Concubine was astonished, asked Kong Cheng Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The concubine was astonished and asked Kong Cheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 成子曰：「康叔者，衛祖也。」

translations.literal: Cheng Zi said: 'Kang Shu was Wei ancestor.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi said: 'Kang Shu is Wei's ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 及生子，男也，以告襄公。

translations.literal: And gave birth son, male, told Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: And she gave birth to a son, a male. She told Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 襄公曰：「天所置也。」

translations.literal: Xiang Gong said: 'Heaven placed it.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang said: 'Heaven has placed it.'

sentences.zh: 名之曰元。

translations.literal: Named him Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: They named him Yuan.

sentences.zh: 襄公夫人無子，於是乃立元為嗣，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong wife had no son, then established Yuan as heir, this was Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang's wife had no son. They then established Yuan as the heir, who became Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 四十二年春，靈公游于郊，令子郢仆。

translations.literal: Forty-second year spring, Ling Gong toured suburbs, commanded Zi Ying drive chariot.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year spring, Duke Ling toured the suburbs and commanded Zi Ying to drive the chariot.

sentences.zh: 郢，靈公少子也，字子南。

translations.literal: Ying, Ling Gong youngest son, courtesy name Zi Nan.
translations.idiomatic: Ying was Duke Ling's youngest son, with the courtesy name Zi Nan.

sentences.zh: 靈公怨太子出奔，謂郢曰：「我將立若為後。」

translations.literal: Ling Gong resented crown prince fled, told Ying said: 'I will establish you as successor.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling resented the crown prince's flight and told Ying: 'I will establish you as my successor.'

sentences.zh: 郢對曰：「郢不足以辱社稷，君更圖之。」

translations.literal: Ying replied said: 'Ying not sufficient to disgrace altars of soil and grain, lord further plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: Ying replied: 'Ying is not sufficient to disgrace the altars of soil and grain. My lord, please plan further.'

sentences.zh: 夏，靈公卒，夫人命子郢為太子，曰：「此靈公命也。」

translations.literal: Summer, Ling Gong died, wife commanded Zi Ying as crown prince, said: 'This Ling Gong command.'
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Ling died. His wife commanded Zi Ying to be crown prince, saying: 'This is Duke Ling's command.'

sentences.zh: 郢曰：「亡人太子蒯聵之子輒在也，不敢當。」

translations.literal: Ying said: 'Exiled crown prince Kuai Kui son Zhe here, dare not accept.'
translations.idiomatic: Ying said: 'The exiled crown prince Kuai Kui's son Zhe is here. I dare not accept.'

sentences.zh: 於是衛乃以輒為君，是為出公。

translations.literal: Then Wei established Zhe as lord, this was Chu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Then Wei established Zhe as lord, who became Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月乙酉，趙簡子欲入蒯聵，乃令陽虎詐命衛十餘人衰绖歸，簡子送蒯聵。

translations.literal: Sixth month Yi You, Zhao Jian Zi desired enter Kuai Kui, then commanded Yang Hu falsely commanded Wei over ten people mourning hemp returned, Jian Zi sent Kuai Kui.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Yi You, Zhao Jian Zi desired to enter Kuai Kui. He then commanded Yang Hu to falsely command over ten Wei people in mourning hemp to return. Jian Zi sent Kuai Kui.

sentences.zh: 衛人聞之，發兵擊蒯聵。

translations.literal: Wei people heard it, raised troops attacked Kuai Kui.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei people heard of it and raised troops to attack Kuai Kui.

sentences.zh: 蒯聵不得入，入宿而保，衛人亦罷兵。

translations.literal: Kuai Kui could not enter, entered Su and defended, Wei people also stopped troops.
translations.idiomatic: Kuai Kui could not enter. He entered Su and defended it. The Wei people also stopped their troops.

sentences.zh: 出公輒四年，齊田乞弒其君孺子。

translations.literal: Chu Gong Zhe fourth year, Qi Tian Qi assassinated their lord Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Chu Zhe's fourth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated their lord Duke Ru.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊鮑子弒其君悼公。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Qi Bao Zi assassinated their lord Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qi's Bao Zi assassinated their lord Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 孔子自陳入衛。

translations.literal: Kong Qiu from Chen entered Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Qiu entered Wei from Chen.

sentences.zh: 九年，孔文子問兵於仲尼，仲尼不對。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Kong Wen Zi asked warfare at Zhong Ni, Zhong Ni not answered.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Kong Wen Zi asked about warfare from Zhong Ni. Zhong Ni did not answer.

sentences.zh: 其後魯迎仲尼，仲尼反魯。

translations.literal: Its after Lu welcomed Zhong Ni, Zhong Ni returned Lu.
translations.idiomatic: After that, Lu welcomed Zhong Ni, and Zhong Ni returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初，孔圉文子取太子蒯聵之姊，生悝。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, beginning, Kong Yu Wen Zi took crown prince Kuai Kui sister, gave birth Pei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, initially Kong Yu Wen Zi took the crown prince Kuai Kui's sister and gave birth to Pei.

sentences.zh: 孔氏之豎渾良夫美好，孔文子卒，良夫通於悝母。

translations.literal: Kong clan attendant Hun Liang Fu beautiful good, Kong Wen Zi died, Liang Fu had relations with Pei mother.
translations.idiomatic: The Kong clan's attendant Hun Liang Fu was beautiful and good. Kong Wen Zi died, and Liang Fu had relations with Pei's mother.

sentences.zh: 太子在宿，悝母使良夫於太子。

translations.literal: Crown prince in Su, Pei mother sent Liang Fu to crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince was in Su. Pei's mother sent Liang Fu to the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子與良夫言曰：「茍能入我國，報子以乘軒，免子三死，毋所與。」

translations.literal: Crown prince with Liang Fu spoke said: 'If able enter my state, repay you with riding xuan, exempt you three deaths, nothing not give.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince spoke with Liang Fu, saying: 'If you can enter my state, I will repay you with riding in a xuan chariot, exempt you from three deaths, and give you everything.'

sentences.zh: 與之盟，許以悝母為妻。

translations.literal: Made alliance with him, promised Pei mother as wife.
translations.idiomatic: He made an alliance with him and promised Pei's mother as his wife.

sentences.zh: 閏月，良夫與太子入，舍孔氏之外圃。

translations.literal: Leap month, Liang Fu with crown prince entered, resided Kong clan outer garden.
translations.idiomatic: In the leap month, Liang Fu entered with the crown prince and resided in the Kong clan's outer garden.

sentences.zh: 昏，二人蒙衣而乘，宦者羅御，如孔氏。

translations.literal: Dusk, two people covered clothes rode, eunuch Luo drove, went to Kong clan.
translations.idiomatic: At dusk, the two people covered their clothes and rode. The eunuch Luo drove, and they went to the Kong clan.

sentences.zh: 孔氏之老欒甯問之，稱姻妾以告。

translations.literal: Kong clan elder Luan Ning asked him, called marriage concubine to tell.
translations.idiomatic: The Kong clan's elder Luan Ning asked him, and he called the marriage concubine to tell him.

sentences.zh: 遂入，適伯姬氏。

translations.literal: Then entered, went to Bo Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: They then entered and went to the Bo Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 既食，悝母杖戈而先，太子與五人介，輿猳從之。

translations.literal: Already eaten, Pei mother held ge spear went first, crown prince with five people armored, carried Xi followed them.
translations.idiomatic: Having eaten, Pei's mother held a ge spear and went first. The crown prince, with five armored men and carrying Xi, followed them.

sentences.zh: 伯姬劫悝於廁，彊盟之，遂劫以登臺。

translations.literal: Bo Ji coerced Pei at toilet, forced allied him, then coerced to ascend tower.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Ji coerced Pei at the toilet and forced him to ally. They then coerced him to ascend the tower.

sentences.zh: 欒甯將飲酒，炙未熟，聞亂，使告仲由。

translations.literal: Luan Ning about to drink wine, roast not ripe, heard chaos, made tell Zhong You.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Ning was about to drink wine. The roast was not ripe when he heard of the chaos and had someone tell Zhong You.

sentences.zh: 召護駕乘車，行爵食炙，奉出公輒奔魯。

translations.literal: Summoned protection harnessed chariot, circulated wine drank roast, served Chu Gong Zhe fled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He summoned protection and harnessed the chariot. They circulated wine and drank roast, served Duke Chu Zhe who fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 仲由將入，遇子羔將出，曰：「門已閉矣。」

translations.literal: Zhong You about to enter, met Zi Gao about to exit, said: 'Gate already closed.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong You was about to enter when he met Zi Gao about to exit, who said: 'The gate is already closed.'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「吾姑至矣。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'I temporarily arrived.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'I have temporarily arrived.'

sentences.zh: 子羔曰：「不及，莫踐其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Gao said: 'Cannot make it, do not step into their difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gao said: 'You cannot make it. Do not step into their difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「食焉不辟其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Eat there not avoid their difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'I eat there and do not avoid their difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 子羔遂出。

translations.literal: Zi Gao then exited.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gao then exited.

sentences.zh: 子路入，及門，公孫敢闔門，曰：「毋入為也！」

translations.literal: Zi Lu entered, reached gate, Gong Sun Gan closed gate, said: 'Do not enter to do it!'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu entered and reached the gate. Gong Sun Gan closed the gate and said: 'Do not enter to do it!'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「是公孫也？

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Is this Gong Sun?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'Is this Gong Sun?'

sentences.zh: 求利而逃其難。

translations.literal: Seek profit and flee their difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: He seeks profit and flees their difficulty.

sentences.zh: 由不然，利其祿，必救其患。」

translations.literal: You not so, profit his salary, must save his calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: I am not like that. I profit from his salary and must save his calamity.'

sentences.zh: 有使者出，子路乃得入。

translations.literal: Had envoy exit, Zi Lu then obtained entry.
translations.idiomatic: An envoy exited, and Zi Lu then obtained entry.

sentences.zh: 曰：「太子焉用孔悝？

translations.literal: Said: 'Crown prince why use Kong Pei?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Why does the crown prince use Kong Pei?'

sentences.zh: 雖殺之，必或繼之。」

translations.literal: Though kill him, must someone succeed him.'
translations.idiomatic: Though we kill him, someone must succeed him.'

sentences.zh: 且曰：「太子無勇。

translations.literal: Moreover said: 'Crown prince without courage.
translations.idiomatic: He moreover said: 'The crown prince has no courage.

sentences.zh: 若燔臺，必舍孔叔。」

translations.literal: If burn tower, must abandon Kong Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: If we burn the tower, we must abandon Kong Shu.'

sentences.zh: 太子聞之，懼，下石乞、盂黶敵子路，以戈擊之，割纓。

translations.literal: Crown prince heard it, feared, descended Shi Qi, Yu Mi opposed Zi Lu, with ge struck him, cut tassel.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince heard it and feared. He descended with Shi Qi and Yu Mi to oppose Zi Lu. They struck him with ge spears and cut his tassel.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「君子死，冠不免。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Gentleman dies, cap not remove.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'A gentleman dies with his cap not removed.'

sentences.zh: 結纓而死。

translations.literal: Tied tassel and died.
translations.idiomatic: He tied his tassel and died.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞衛亂，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Kong Qiu heard Wei chaos, said: 'Alas!'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Qiu heard of Wei's chaos and said: 'Alas!'

sentences.zh: 柴也其來乎？

translations.literal: Chai will come?'
translations.idiomatic: Will Chai come?'

sentences.zh: 由也其死矣。」

translations.literal: You will die.'
translations.idiomatic: You will die.'

sentences.zh: 孔悝竟立太子蒯聵，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Kong Pei finally established crown prince Kuai Kui, this was Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Pei finally established Crown Prince Kuai Kui, who became Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公蒯聵者，出公父也，居外，怨大夫莫迎立。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong Kuai Kui was Chu Gong father, resided outside, resented grand officers none welcomed established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang Kuai Kui was Duke Chu's father. He resided outside and resented that none of the grand officers welcomed and established him.

sentences.zh: 元年即位，欲盡誅大臣，曰：「寡人居外久矣，子亦嘗聞之乎？」

translations.literal: First year ascended throne, desired completely execute ministers, said: 'I resided outside long, you also once heard it?'
translations.idiomatic: In his first year he ascended the throne and desired to completely execute the ministers, saying: 'I resided outside for a long time. Have you also once heard of it?'

sentences.zh: 群臣欲作亂，乃止。

translations.literal: Multitude ministers desired make rebellion, then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The multitude of ministers desired to make rebellion, so he stopped.

sentences.zh: 二年，魯孔丘卒。

translations.literal: Second year, Lu Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Lu's Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 三年，莊公上城，見戎州。

translations.literal: Third year, Zhuang Gong ascended city wall, saw Rong state.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Duke Zhuang ascended the city wall and saw Rong state.

sentences.zh: 曰：「戎虜何為是？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Rong captives why here?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Why are Rong captives here?'

sentences.zh: 戎州病之。

translations.literal: Rong state was angered by it.
translations.idiomatic: Rong state was angered by it.

sentences.zh: 十月，戎州告趙簡子，簡子圍衛。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Rong state told Zhao Jian Zi, Jian Zi surrounded Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Rong state told Zhao Jian Zi, and Jian Zi surrounded Wei.

sentences.zh: 十一月，莊公出奔，衛人立公子斑師為衛君。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Zhuang Gong fled, Wei people established prince Ban Shi as Wei lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Duke Zhuang fled, and the Wei people established Prince Ban Shi as Wei's lord.

sentences.zh: 齊伐衛，虜斑師，更立公子起為衛君。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Wei, captured Ban Shi, changed established prince Qi as Wei lord.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Wei, captured Ban Shi, and changed to establish Prince Qi as Wei's lord.

sentences.zh: 衛君起元年，衛石曼尃逐其君起，起奔齊。

translations.literal: Wei lord Qi first year, Wei Shi Man Duo expelled his lord Qi, Qi fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In Wei lord Qi's first year, Wei's Shi Man Duo expelled his lord Qi, and Qi fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 衛出公輒自齊復歸立。

translations.literal: Wei Chu Gong Zhe from Qi again returned established.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Duke Chu Zhe from Qi again returned and was established.

sentences.zh: 初，出公立十二年亡，亡在外四年復入。

translations.literal: Beginning, Chu Gong ascended twelve years fled, fled outside four years again entered.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Chu ascended for twelve years and fled. He fled outside for four years and again entered.

sentences.zh: 出公後元年，賞從亡者。

translations.literal: Chu Gong after returning first year, rewarded those who followed him in fleeing.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Chu's first year after returning, he rewarded those who had followed him in flight.

sentences.zh: 立二十一年卒，出公季父黔攻出公子而自立，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Ascended twenty-one years died, Chu Gong younger uncle Qian attacked Chu Gong son and self established, this was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He ascended for twenty-one years and died. Duke Chu's younger uncle Qian attacked Duke Chu's son and self-established, becoming Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公五年卒，子敬公弗立。

translations.literal: Dao Gong fifth year died, son Jing Gong Fu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao died in his fifth year, and his son Duke Jing Fu ascended.

sentences.zh: 敬公十九年卒，子昭公糾立。

translations.literal: Jing Gong nineteenth year died, son Zhao Gong Jiu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died in his nineteenth year, and his son Duke Zhao Jiu ascended.

sentences.zh: 是時三晉彊，衛如小侯，屬之。

translations.literal: This time three Jin strong, Wei like small hou, belonged to them.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the three Jin were strong. Wei was like a small hou and belonged to them.

sentences.zh: 昭公六年，公子亹弒之代立，是為懷公。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong sixth year, prince Wei assassinated him replaced him, this was Huai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's sixth year, Prince Wei assassinated him and replaced him, becoming Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公十一年，公子穨弒懷公而代立，是為慎公。

translations.literal: Huai Gong eleventh year, prince Kui assassinated Huai Gong and replaced him, this was Shen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huai's eleventh year, Prince Kui assassinated Duke Huai and replaced him, becoming Duke Shen.

sentences.zh: 慎公父，公子適；

translations.literal: Shen Gong father, prince Di;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen's father was Prince Di;

sentences.zh: 適父，敬公也。

translations.literal: Di father, Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Di's father was Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 慎公四十二年卒，子聲公訓立。

translations.literal: Shen Gong forty-second year died, son Sheng Gong Xun ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen died in his forty-second year, and his son Duke Sheng Xun ascended.

sentences.zh: 聲公十一年卒，子成侯遫立。

translations.literal: Sheng Gong eleventh year died, son Cheng Hou Suo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Sheng died in his eleventh year, and his son Marquis Cheng Suo ascended.

sentences.zh: 成侯十一年，公孫鞅入秦。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou eleventh year, Gong Sun Yang entered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Marquis Cheng's eleventh year, Gong Sun Yang entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，衛更貶號曰侯。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Wei changed demoted title called hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Wei changed and demoted its title to hou.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，成侯卒，子平侯立。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Cheng Hou died, son Ping Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Marquis Cheng died, and his son Marquis Ping ascended.

sentences.zh: 平侯八年卒，子嗣君立。

translations.literal: Ping Hou eighth year died, son Si Jun ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Ping died in his eighth year, and his son Lord Si ascended.

sentences.zh: 嗣君五年，更貶號曰君，獨有濮陽。

translations.literal: Si Jun fifth year, changed demoted title called jun, alone had Pu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Si's fifth year, they changed and demoted the title to jun, and he alone had Pu Yang.

sentences.zh: 四十二年卒，子懷君立。

translations.literal: Forty-second year died, son Huai Jun ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the forty-second year, and his son Lord Huai ascended.

sentences.zh: 懷君三十一年，朝魏，魏囚殺懷君。

translations.literal: Huai Jun thirty-first year, paid court to Wei, Wei imprisoned killed Huai Jun.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Huai's thirty-first year, he paid court to Wei, and Wei imprisoned and killed Lord Huai.

sentences.zh: 魏更立嗣君弟，是為元君。

translations.literal: Wei changed established heir lord younger brother, this was Yuan Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Wei changed and established the heir lord's younger brother, who became Lord Yuan.

sentences.zh: 元君為魏婿，故魏立之。

translations.literal: Yuan Jun was Wei son-in-law, therefore Wei established him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Yuan was Wei's son-in-law, so Wei established him.

sentences.zh: 元君十四年，秦拔魏東地，秦初置東郡，更徙衛野王縣，而并濮陽為東郡。

translations.literal: Yuan Jun fourteenth year, Qin seized Wei east land, Qin first established Dong commandery, changed moved Wei Ye Wang county, and combined Pu Yang as Dong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Yuan's fourteenth year, Qin seized Wei's eastern lands. Qin first established Dong commandery, changed and moved Wei's Ye Wang county, and combined Pu Yang as Dong commandery.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，元君卒，子君角立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Yuan Jun died, son Jun Jiao ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Lord Yuan died, and his son Lord Jiao ascended.

sentences.zh: 君角九年，秦并天下，立為始皇帝。

translations.literal: Jun Jiao ninth year, Qin united world, established as First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Jiao's ninth year, Qin united the world and established the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，二世廢君角為庶人，衛絕祀。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Second Emperor demoted Jun Jiao to commoner, Wei ended sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, the Second Emperor demoted Lord Jiao to a commoner, and Wei's sacrifices ended.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余讀世家言，至於宣公之太子以婦見誅，弟壽爭死以相讓，此與晉太子申生不敢明驪姬之過同，俱惡傷父之志。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I read hereditary houses speak, arrived at Xuan Gong crown prince because wife seen executed, younger brother Shou contended death to yield each other, this with Jin crown prince Shen Sheng dared not clarify Li Ji transgression same, both disliked injure father intention.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I read the hereditary houses' accounts and came to where Duke Xuan's crown prince was executed because of his wife. His younger brother Shou contended to die in order to yield to him. This was the same as Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng who dared not clarify Li Ji's transgressions. Both disliked injuring their father's intentions.

sentences.zh: 然卒死亡，何其悲也！

translations.literal: Yet finally died death, how sad!
translations.idiomatic: Yet they finally died. How sad!

sentences.zh: 或父子相殺，兄弟相滅，亦獨何哉？

translations.literal: Some father son mutually kill, brothers mutually extinguish, also only what?
translations.idiomatic: Some fathers and sons kill each other, brothers extinguish each other—what else?
